SEARCH
Package classes

Class EventOrganizer

java.lang.Object
classes.EventOrganizer
public class EventOrganizer extends Object
Class that regulates interactive manipulation of an EventCalendar. Using Scanner to take in user input to alter an EventCalendar.
Author:
Abhishek Thakare, Adhit Thakur

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Runner for Scanner input processing. Taking in user input until "Q" is entered. Processing each command at a very high level.

    • runThroughNonEdgeCases

      public void runThroughNonEdgeCases(Event[] collection, EventCalendar calendar, String[] contents)
      Determining what to output to user after all edge cases are tackled.
      Parameters:
      collection - Event[] to be used.
      calendar - EventCalendar to be altered.
      contents - User input line to be processed.

    • aCommandInit

      public void aCommandInit(Event[] collection, EventCalendar calendar, String[] contents)

      calendar - EventCalendar to be altered.
      contents - User input line to be processed.

      Parameters:
      collection - Event[] to be used.
      calendar - EventCalendar to be altered.
      contents - User input line to be processed.

    • rCommandChecker

      public void rCommandChecker(Event[] collection, EventCalendar calendar, String[] contents)
      Package the remove command processing. Determine whether Event can be removed and performing the operation.
      Parameters:
      collection - Event[] to be used.
      calendar - EventCalendar to be altered.
      contents - User input line to be processed.

    • pCommandChecker

      public void pCommandChecker(Event[] collection, EventCalendar calendar, String[] contents)
      Process printing the unsorted calendar if the "P" command is correctly entered.
      Parameters:
      collection - Event[] to be used.
      calendar - EventCalendar to be altered.
      contents - User input line to be processed.

    • isValidCommand

      private boolean isValidCommand(String str)
      Check if the given command is of proper type. Determining if the command is one of the 6 possible inputs.
      Parameters:
      str - Command to be checked.
      Returns:
      true if command is one of 6 possible inputs, otherwise false.

    • isValidEvent

      private String isValidEvent(String[] contents)
      Determine if the event to be added is valid. Process each component of Event to ensure it is fully valid. Generate appropriate message.
      Parameters:
      contents - Command to be checked.
      Returns:
      Error message depending on the issue with Event parameter, otherwise "valid".

    • isValidRemove

      private String isValidRemove(String[] contents)
      Determines if the event to be removed is valid. Checks if Date, Timeslot, and Location are proper.
      Parameters:
      contents - The remove command to be processed.
      Returns:
      Error message depending on the issue with Event parameter, otherwise "valid".

    • createEvent

      private Event createEvent(String[] contents)
      Creating an event based on user input to add. Once Event is determined to be valid, generate Event. Add that event to the EventCalendar.
      Parameters:
      contents - Command to be processed into an Event.
      Returns:
      the Event that will be added to the EventCalendar.

    • createEventForRemove

      private Event createEventForRemove(String[] contents)
      Creating an event based on user input to remove. Once Event is determined to be valid, generate Event. Remove that event from the EventCalendar.
      Parameters:
      contents - Command to be processed into an Event.
      Returns:
      the Event that will be added to the EventCalendar.

    • createTimeSlot

      private Timeslot createTimeSlot(String str)
      Create a Timeslot for an Event based on user input. Once Event is determined to be valid, create its Timeslot. Turn the String input into a Timeslot enum constant.
      Parameters:
      str - The string to be converted to Timeslot enum.
      Returns:
      the Timeslot enum constant that was generated.

    • createLocation

      private Location createLocation(String str)
      Create a Location for an Event based on user input. Once Event is determined to be valid, create its Location. Turn the String input into a Location enum constant.
      Parameters:
      str - The string to be converted to Location enum.
      Returns:
      the Location enum constant that was generated.

    • createDepartment

      private Department createDepartment(String str)
      Create a Department for an Event based on user input. Once Event is determined to be valid, create its Department. Turn the String input into a Department enum constant.
      Parameters:
      str - The string to be converted to Department enum.
      Returns:
      the Department enum constant that was generated.
